metadata.title: CVE-2018-16874 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - medium
metadata.description: In Go before 1.10.6 and 1.11.x before 1.11.3, the "go get" command isvulnerable to directory traversal when executed with the import path of amalicious Go package which contains curly braces (both '{' and '}'characters). Specifically, it is only vulnerable in GOPATH mode, but not inmodule mode (the distinction is documented athttps://golang.org/cmd/go/#hdr-Module_aware_go_get). The attacker can causean arbitrary filesystem write, which can lead to code execution.

criterions.comment: golang: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
golang-1.6: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
golang-1.10: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
